# regexp/no-invisible-character

ðŸ’¼ This rule is enabled in the following configs: ðŸŸ¢ `flat/recommended`, ðŸ”µ `recommended`.

ðŸ”§ This rule is automatically fixable by the [`--fix` CLI option](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/user-guide/command-line-interface#--fix).

<!-- end auto-generated rule header -->

> disallow invisible raw character

## :book: Rule Details

This rule disallows using invisible characters other than SPACE (`U+0020`) without using escapes.

<eslint-code-block fix>

<!-- markdownlint-disable no-hard-tabs -->

```js
/* eslint regexp/no-invisible-character: "error" */

/* âœ“ GOOD */
var foo = /\t/;
var foo = /\v/;
var foo = /\f/;
var foo = /\u3000/;
var foo = / /; // SPACE (`U+0020`)

/* âœ— BAD */
var foo = /	/;
var foo = //;
var foo = //;
var foo = /ã€€/;
```

<!-- markdownlint-enable no-hard-tabs -->

</eslint-code-block>

## :wrench: Options

Nothing.

## :rocket: Version

This rule was introduced in eslint-plugin-regexp v0.1.0
